column4: i freshly installed fiesty once and had not yet installed samba. funny thing was i was still able to access windows XP file. any one know the reason?
the samba file system driver is part of the kernel
the samba client is installed by default
your using a client to connect "to" a share
but i am sure that samba was not part of the daper drake kernel. am i wrong. because in that it was impossible to connect to windows without getting samba connected
it's been in the kernel for a while
some one told me may be it the enabled sharing was due to avahi network tools which started shipping with fiesty
remember, your not sharing - your mounting using the sambaclient and file system
I'm not aware of that package are you making a genuine request
yup.. is a debian pkg. lot of debate going on slash dot weather it should have been included in the pkg... Is a system monitor where i girl removes clothes as the cpu usage increases
he doesn't need a machine name user adding
i had the same prob once it worked fine! with that. any other name was not loggin in
any other name was workin with other distros though
